title: Kansas teen shot in hunting accident
content:
DELIA (KSNT)- Three boys hunting for turkeys took a turn for the worse, after a 15-year-old was shot in the leg.
The incident occurred shortly before 8 a.m. on Sunday, approximately ½ a mile north of 118th and B road near Delia, Kansas.
The Jackson County Sheriff’s Office said three boys who are all underage were hunting for turkeys, when a shotgun accidently discharged striking a 15-year-old in the leg. The boy holding the gun that went off is reportedly under 10 years of age.
The victim was taken to the hospital and remains in stable condition. No adults were present at the time of the accident.
